page.title: 02THE NATIONAL PARK
page.content: Half the area falls within the North Yorkshire National Park which was set up in 1952. The Boundaries follow the old Parish Borders or roads. The Park Officers mark footpaths, set out Nature Trails and institute some tree planting,mainly coniferous. The Park Land is privately owned and is leased by the Forestry Commission. At the top of Sutton Bank there is an Information Centre and two large car parks. This centre is situated on the Cleveland Way, a Long_Distance Footpath. The whole Park is divided into sections each controlled by a Ranger. The Central Office for the Park is at Helmsley.
